document.masterDocTitle: Zapada (Plecoptera: Nemouridae), a stonefly genus new to the fauna of China

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Zapada (Plecoptera: Nemouridae), a stonefly genus new to the fauna of China

mods:name.mods:affiliation: School of Grain Science and Technology, Jiangsu University of Science and Technology, Zhenjiang 212004, China.

figureCitation.captionText-6: FIGURE 7. Zapada kondratieffi sp. nov., holotype, male epiproct, A–B. dorsal view; C–D. caudal view; E–F. lateral view; G– H. ventral view. Abbreviations: ds = dorsal sclerite of epiproct; vs = ventral sclerite of epiproct; bs = basal sclerite of epiproct.
figureCitation.captionText-7: FIGURE 8. Zapada kondratieffi sp. nov., holotype, A. male terminalia after NaOH treatment, ventral view; B. detail of sternum 10, ventral view; C. male right paraproct, ventral view; D. male right paraproct, ventral view. Abbreviations: ST, abdominal sternum; ce = cerci; pp = paraproct; ep = epiproct; ve = vesicle; hp = hypoproct; ppok, outer knob of paraproct; ppip, inner protuberance of paraproct.
figureCitation.captionText-8: FIGURE 9. Phylogenetic trees of Zapada:A. Bayesian tree, values at nodes indicate posterior probabilities; B. Maximum likelihood tree, values at nodes indicate bootstrap support, values of several comblike intraspecific clusters unmarked for aesthetics.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Type material.
Holotype male (ICJUST), Sichuan Province , Xiaojin County , Siguniangshan Town , Siguniang Mountain Scenic Area , an unnamed stream ( Fig. 1A–C ), 30.9336°N , 102.8845°E , alt.
4100 m
,
16.VII.2021
, Zhi-Teng Chen leg.
Paratype : one male (ICJUST), same data as holotype
.
Etymology. The new species is named after Dr. Boris C. Kondratieff, who has made great contributions to Plecoptera science.

Description. Measurements.
Holotype : BL = 6.0 mm; FL = 6.5 mm ; HL = 5.0 mm. Paratype : BL = 6.0 mm; FL = 6.0 mm; HL = 5.0 mm.

, holotype, male abdomen before NaOH treatment, A. dorsal view; B. ventral view; C. lateral view; D. caudal view. Abbreviations: T, abdominal tergum; ST, abdominal sternum; ce = cerci; pp = paraproct; ep = epiproct; ve = vesicle; hp = hypoproct.

subSubSection.paragraph: Wings. Macropterous ( Figs. 2–3 ), forewing membrane a translucent charcoal-gray, most cells with rounded pale spots; veins brown; margins of wings fringed with short bristles. Hindwings without spots. Both wing pairs with the X-structure typical of the family. In forewings, C strong and setose; h short and stout; Sc subapically nearly touching C, ScP joins RA before ra-rp; single crossvein present between C and Sc besides h; RA slightly curved, terminal costal crossvein joins RA after ra-rp; RP forked shortly after ra-rp; M forked basal to the fork of RP; joint of r-m and M interrupted; four to five crossveins present between M and CuA; six to seven crossveins present between CuA and CuP; CuP ended before half of wing length; cu-a present; AA1 sinuous, AA2 forked near midpoint. In hindwings, C, Sc, RA and RP similar to forewings; M forked distal to the fork of RP; m-cu and the single crossvein between CuA and CuP simple; CuP simple; anal area large and folded with five simple anal veins.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Diagnosis. The new species can be easily distinguished from its Nearctic congeners by presence of five simple cervical gills and vestigial inner paraproct lobes ( Baumann 1975 , Baumann & Mingo 1987 ,
Grubbs et al . 2015
). It is closely related to the Asian
Z. quadribranchiata ( Zhiltzova, 1977 )
by sharing reduced inner paraproct lobes but can be distinguished by the bilobed epiproct apex and absence of Y-shaped structure on ventral epiproct sclerite apart from the unique presence of an extra median cervical gill ( Zhiltzova 1977 , Zhiltzova & Teslenko 2001 ).
Distribution. China : central Sichuan Province ( Fig. 1A ).
